required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of LY3484356 Versus Hormone Therapy, in Participants With Estrogen Receptor Positive (ER+), Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 Negative (HER2-) Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: EMBER-3: A Randomized, Open-Label, Phase 3 Study of LY3484356 vs Investigator's Choice of Endocrine Therapy, in Patients With Estrogen Receptor Positive, HER2 Negative Locally Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer Previously Treated With Endocrine Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to measure how well LY3484356 works compared to hormone therapy in participants with breast cancer that is estrogen receptor positive (ER+) and human epidermal receptor 2 negative (HER2-). Participants must have breast cancer that is advanced or has spread to another part of the body. Study participation could last up to 5 years.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to the date of first documented progression of disease or death from any cause (estimated as up to 3 years)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization until death from any cause (estimated as up to 5 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR): Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Confirmed Best Overall Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization until measured progressive disease (estimated as up to 1 year)
Date of CR or PR to date of disease progression or death due to any cause (estimated up to 3 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR): Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Best Overall Response of CR, PR or Stable Disease for Greater than or Equal to (â‰¥) 24 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization until measured progressive disease (estimated as up to 1 year)

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS by Estrogen Receptor 1 Gene (ESR1) Mutation Status in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to the date of first documented progression of disease or death from any cause (estimated as up to 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator-assessed PFS by ESR1 mutation status in plasma

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to the date of first documented progression of disease or death from any cause(estimated as up to 3 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes (PRO): Time to Worsening of "Worst Pain"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through follow-up (estimated as up to 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the Worst Pain Numeric Rating Scale (NRS). NRS is a single item, participant-administered, 11-point horizontal scale anchored at 0 and 10, with 0 representing "no pain" and 10 representing "pain as bad as you can imagine."

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Steady State Plasma Concentrations of LY3484356
secondary_outcome.description: PK: steady state plasma concentrations of LY3484356

arm_group.description: Investigator's choice of exemestane administered orally or fulvestrant administered intramuscularly (IM).

criteria.textblock:
- Have a diagnosis of ER+, HER2- locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer
- Have disease that has demonstrated progression on or after an aromatase inhibitor alone or in combination with a cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK)4/6 inhibitor.
- Must be deemed appropriate for treatment with endocrine therapy
- If female, have a postmenopausal status by natural or surgical means or by ovarian function suppression
- Have RECIST evaluable disease (measurable disease and/or nonmeasurable bone-only disease)
- Have a performance status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group scale (Oken et al. 1982)
- Have adequate renal, hematologic, and hepatic organ function
- Must be able to swallow capsules/tablets
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received prior treatment with chemotherapy (except for neoadjuvant/ adjuvant chemotherapy), fulvestrant, or any investigational-ER-directed therapy (including SERDs and non-SERDs), any PI3K-, mTOR- or AKT- inhibitor
- Have visceral crisis, lymphangitic spread within the lung, or any evidence of leptomeningeal disease.
- Have symptomatic or untreated brain metastasis.
- Have serious preexisting medical conditions that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude participation in this study
- Known allergic reaction against any of the components of the study treatment

link.description: Study of LY3484356 Versus Hormone Therapy, in Participants With Estrogen Receptor Positive (ER+), Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 Negative (HER2-) Breast Cancer (EMBER-3)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and European Union (EU), whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
